fields.description:
*Assessment*

euca-import-keypair and euca-create-keypair return a vague error when using an non-ASCII character for the keyname.
{code}
# euca-create-keypair ädmin-hspencer-v2 --region admin-hspencer@group1
euca-create-keypair: error: ascii

# euca-import-keypair -f admin-hspencer.pub ädmin-hspencer-v2 --region admin-hspencer@group1
euca-import-keypair: error: ascii
{code}

Compare this behavior to the EC2 API Tools, and the following error message gets returned:
{code}
$ ec2-create-keypair test-cätz
Client.InvalidParameterValue: Value (test-cätz) for parameter KeyName is invalid. Character sets beyond ASCII are not supported.
{code}

ec2-create-keypair utilizes the {{InvalidParameterValue}} error code documented in the [error codes section AWS EC2 API documentation|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/errors-overview.html].

*Signs*

* debug output using ec2-create-keypair:
{code}
$ ec2-create-keypair test-cätz --debug --verbose
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.10.1]
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.10.1]
------------------------------[ REQUEST ]-------------------------------

        <wsu:Expires xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd">2015-02-04T01:59:36.563Z</wsu:Expires>
      </wsu:Timestamp>
      <wsse:BinarySecurityToken
        EncodingType="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary"
        ValueType="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3"
        wsu:Id="CertId-1523501"
        xmlns:wsse="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd" xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd"></wsse:BinarySecurityToken>
      <ds:Signature Id="Signature-1707824402" xmlns:ds="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">
        <ds:SignedInfo>

          </ds:Reference>
          <ds:Reference URI="#id-858732546">

            </ds:Transforms>

            <ds:DigestValue>dK5VLKbDolZe4VBdu3NL+lDEkrY=</ds:DigestValue>

fields.summary: euca-create-keypair/euca-import-keypair returns vague error when non-ASCII characters used for key name

comments.body: Relating it to GUI-1559 to make sure CLI and GUI respond with the same behavior.
I think this is dup for TOOLS-385
